title: PyTorch Windows build errors out because of older Caffe2
body_html:
If you try to build PyTorch latest master following instructions, you will ultimately get this error:

"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\apply_test.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2_gpu.vcxproj" (default target) (17) ->
(CustomBuild target) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\Common7\IDE\VC\VCTargets\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets(171,5): error MSB6006: "cmd.exe" exited with code 1. [C:\GitHubS
rc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2_gpu.vcxproj]

    332 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)

The cause of the error is that the version of Caffe2 included with PyTorch has issue compiling with VS2017. Looks like this issue was fixed in Caffe2 so may be updating version in PyTorch might fix current build issue.

body:
If you try to build PyTorch latest master following instructions, you will ultimately get this error:

```
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\apply_test.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
"C:\GitHubSrc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2_gpu.vcxproj" (default target) (17) ->
(CustomBuild target) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\Common7\IDE\VC\VCTargets\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets(171,5): error MSB6006: "cmd.exe" exited with code 1. [C:\GitHubS
rc\pytorch\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2_gpu.vcxproj]

    332 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)
```

The cause of the error is that the version of [Caffe2](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/tree/master/caffe2) included with PyTorch has [issue](https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/774) compiling with VS2017. Looks like this issue was fixed in Caffe2 so may be updating version in PyTorch might fix current build issue.
